content.text:
# Austin Film Critics Association Awards 2016

12th AFCA Awards
----
Best Film:
Moonlight
The 12th Austin Film Critics Association Awards, honoring the best in filmmaking for 2016, were announced on December 28, 2016.
Winners and nominees
{| class=wikitable style="width=100%"
|-
!style="width=50%"|Best Film
!style="width=50%"|Best Director
|-
| valign="top" |
# Moonlight
# La La Land
# Arrival
# The Handmaiden
# Manchester by the Sea
# Elle
# Hell or High Water
# The Lobster
# Jackie
# Sing Street
| valign="top" |
* 'Barry Jenkins – Moonlight'
** Park Chan-wook – The Handmaiden
** Damien Chazelle – La La Land
** Kenneth Lonergan – Manchester by the Sea
** Denis Villeneuve – Arrival
|-
!style="width=50%"|Best Actor
!style="width=50%"|Best Actress
|-
| valign="top" |
* 'Casey Affleck – Manchester by the Sea'
** Joel Edgerton – Loving
** Colin Farrell – The Lobster
** Ryan Gosling – La La Land
** Denzel Washington – Fences
| valign="top" |
* 'Isabelle Huppert – Elle'
** Amy Adams – Arrival
** Annette Bening – 20th Century Women
** Ruth Negga – Loving
** Natalie Portman – Jackie
|-
!style="width=50%"|Best Supporting Actor
!style="width=50%"|Best Supporting Actress
|-
| valign="top" |
* 'Mahershala Ali – Moonlight'
** Jeff Bridges – Hell or High Water
** Ben Foster – Hell or High Water
** Trevante Rhodes – Moonlight
** Michael Shannon – Nocturnal Animals
| valign="top" |
* 'Viola Davis – Fences'
** Greta Gerwig – 20th Century Women
** Naomie Harris – Moonlight
** Min-hee Kim – The Handmaiden
** Michelle Williams – Manchester by the Sea
|-
!style="width=50%"|Best Original Screenplay
!style="width=50%"|Best Adapted Screenplay
|-
| valign="top" |
* 'Moonlight – Barry Jenkins'
** 20th Century Women – Mike Mills
** La La Land – Damien Chazelle
** The Lobster – Yorgos Lanthimos and Efthimis Filippou
** Manchester by the Sea – Kenneth Lonergan
| valign="top" |
* 'Arrival – Eric Heisserer'
** The Handmaiden – Park Chan-wook and Jeong Seo-kyeong
** Lion – Luke Davies
** Love & Friendship – Whit Stillman
** Nocturnal Animals – Tom Ford
|-
!style="width=50%"|Best Animated Film
!style="width=50%"|Best Foreign Language Film
|-
| valign="top" |
* Kubo and the Two Strings
** The Little Prince
** Moana
** Tower
** Zootopia
| valign="top" |
* The Handmaiden
** The Brand New Testament
** Elle
** Things to Come
** Toni Erdmann
|-
!style="width=50%"|Best First Film
!style="width=50%"|Best Documentary
|-
| valign="top" |
* The Witch
** The Birth of a Nation
** The Edge of Seventeen
** Krisha
** Swiss Army Man
| valign="top" |
* Tower
** 13th
** I Am Not Your Negro
** O.J.: Made in America
** Weiner
|-
!style="width=50%"|Best Cinematography
!style="width=50%"|Best Score
|-
| valign="top" |
* 'La La Land – Linus Sandgren'
** Arrival – Bradford Young
** The Handmaiden – Chung Chung-hoon
** Jackie – Stéphane Fontaine
** Moonlight – James Laxton
| valign="top" |
* 'La La Land – Justin Hurwitz'
** Arrival – Jóhann Jóhannsson
** Hell or High Water – Nick Cave and Warren Ellis
** Jackie – Mica Levi
** The Neon Demon – Cliff Martinez
|-
!style="width=50%"|Bobby McCurdy Memorial Breakthrough Artist Award
!style="width=50%"| Austin Film Award
|-
| valign="top" |
* 'Keith Maitland – Tower'
** Barry Jenkins – Moonlight
** Sasha Lane – American Honey
** Trevante Rhodes – Moonlight
** Anya Taylor-Joy – The Witch
| valign="top" |
* 'Tower – Keith Maitland'
** Loving – Jeff Nichols
** Midnight Special – Jeff Nichols
** Slash – Clay Liford
** Transpecos – Greg Kwedar
|-
|-
! colspan="2" | Special Honorary Award
|-
| colspan=2 valign="top" width="50%"|
* Ensemble cast of Moonlight and casting director Yesi Ramirez for excellence as an ensemble.
* Anton Yelchin for his contribution to the cinema of 2016, including performances in Green Room and Star Trek Beyond. His was a brilliant career cut profoundly short.
* A24 for excellence in production in distribution. Their work gave us Moonlight, Green Room, Swiss Army Man, The Lobster, The Witch, and 20th Century Women, among others.
* Keith Maitland and his film Tower for revisiting a tragic event in Austin, Texas history in a sensitive and unique manner.
|}
